channel.title: NetBeans Screencasts and Video Demos
channel.description: Screencasts that show you all the cool features of NetBeans, the free and open-source IDE for Java development and scripting.

item.title: Video: AngularJS and Java EE in NetBeans IDE
item.description: A demo featuring NetBeans IDE to create an AngularJS application with a RESTful backend.

item.title: How to Develop in Java on the Raspberry Pi
item.description: Learn to use NetBeans IDE to create JRE distributions and deploy them directly to your embedded device.

item.title: A Little REST with JAX-RS 2.0 and Java EE 7
item.description: Adam Bien demonstrates a better approach to creating RESTful Web applications with Java EE 7, and highlights new JAX-RS 2.0 features.

item.title: 14 NetBeans Web Development Secrets
item.description: A quick video treat for web developers: 14 hidden NetBeans features that will make working with HTML5 a breeze.

item.title: Java EE 7 with NetBeans and Vaadin
item.description: Learn to use Vaadin with tools in NetBeans IDE to build a fullstack Vaadin, JPA, GlassFish application.

item.title: PrimeFaces Development with NetBeans IDE
item.description: Use NetBeans IDE to create a complete CRUD application with Java EE 7, Maven, and PrimeFaces.

item.title: Install and Use Java ME SDK 8.0 Plugins in NetBeans IDE
item.description: Installing and using Java ME SDK 8.0 Plugins in NetBeans IDE on Windows.

item.title: NetBeans IDE 8.0 Overview
item.description: Find out what's new and noteworthy in the latest NetBeans release.

item.title: Setting up a GitHub Repository Using NetBeans IDE
item.description: Set up a Git repository in NetBeans IDE and put it up to GitHub using the IDE's support for the Git versioning system.

item.title: Java ME 8 Support in NetBeans IDE
item.description: This screencast demonstrates NetBeans IDE support for Oracle Java ME SDK 8 Early Access on the Windows operating system.

item.title: NetBeans IDE: Smart Migration to JDK 8
item.description: A complete guide to the key language enhancement features in Java 8.

item.title: Getting Started with Cordova in NetBeans IDE
item.description: This screencast demonstrates how to create applications that use HTML, JavaScript, and CSS, and then deploy them as native Android or iOS applications via Cordova.
